metadata.name: Linux Package Uninstall
metadata.comment: Detects linux package removal using builtin tools such as "yum", "apt", "apt-get" or "dpkg".

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND (endswith(lower(process.name), lower('/yum')) AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('erase')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('remove'))) OR (endswith(lower(process.name), lower('/apt')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('/apt-get'))) AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('remove')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('purge'))) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('/dpkg')) AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('--remove ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' -r '))) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('/rpm')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' -e '))))

output.summary: Detects linux package removal using builtin tools such as "yum", "apt", "apt-get" or "dpkg".

metadata.objective: False positive: Administrator or administrator scripts might delete packages for several reasons (debugging, troubleshooting). References: https://sysdig.com/blog/mitre-defense-evasion-falco, https://www.tutorialspoint.com/how-to-install-a-software-on-linux-using-yum-command, https://linuxhint.com/uninstall_yum_package/, https://linuxhint.com/uninstall-debian-packages/
